1.title: Joe Palooka
1.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: 8 v. : ill. ; 24 cm.
Caption title.
Scrapbooks of daily comic strips dated from September 9, 1939 to February 17, 1942, and from December 29, 1945 to September 24, 1960.
Later strips signed: M. Leff. 1. Boxers (Sports)
Comic books, strips, etc. 2. Sports comics. I. Fisher, Ham. II. Leff, M. Call no.: PN6728.J57F6 1939

2.title: Joe Palooka [microform]
2.author: [No author]
2.library has: no. 1. 1. Sports comics. I. Series. II. Columbia Comic Corporation. Call no.
notes: Published no. 1 (1942) - no. 4 (1944), cf. Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide.
Microfilm. St. Clair Shores, Mich. : J. Bails.
positive ; 16 mm.
(Jerry Bails Microfilm Library of Comic Art)

3.title: Joe Palooka : examples
3.author: [No author]
3.series: p. 189-190, 201) in Old Time Comics, a scrapbook of daily strips and panels collected by Marvin Wisecup, ca. 1930 with some later additions. Call no.: folio PN6726.W5 1930z

4.title: Joe Palooka [sound recording] : two episodes from the radio show.
4.author: [No author]
notes: on 1 sound tape reel (ca. 30 min.) : 3 3/5 ips, mono ; 7 in., 1/4 in tape.
From a George Garabedian Mark 56 record, 1974. 1. Boxers (Sports)
Drama. 2. Sports comics
Miscellanea. a. Voice Library. Call no.: Voice Lib., M2394, bd.2

5.heading: "Joe Palooka" / by Ham Fisher. 6 p. in Big Shot, no. 44 (Mar.
5.author: [No author]
notes: Apparently pasted up from newspaper strips.
Lou Mougin, via Grand Comics Database Project, has assigned the this segment the title "Little Max, Stowaway"*

6.title: Joe Palooka.
6.author: [No author]
notes: MÃ©xico, D.F. : La Prensa, .
Translated from English.

7.heading: Joe Palooka.
7.title: Humphrey Comics.
7.author: [No author]
7.library has: no. 17, 19 (1951) I. Harvey Publications. II. Joe Palooka. Call no.
notes: Published no. 1 (Oct. 1948) - no. 40 (1954), cf. Comic Book Price Guide.
Joe Palooka's pal.

8.heading: Joe Palooka.
8.title: Little Max Comics [microform]
8.author: [No author]
8.library has: no. 1. 1. Funny kid comics. I. Joe Palooka. II. Series. III. Harvey. k. Max. Call no.

Joe Palooka's pal.
Microfilm. St. Clair Shores, Mich. : J. Bails
positive ; 16 mm.
(Jerry Bails Microfilm Library of Comic Art)

9.title: Joe Palooka
9.author: by Ham Fisher
9.appears_in: reproduced on p. 52 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Joe plays golf with Bobby Jones.

10.title: Joe Palooka
10.author: by Ham Fisher
10.appears_in: reproduced on p. 52 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Joe gets nervous and can't hit the golf ball anymore.

11.title: Joe Palooka
11.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe has won the world championship back, and doesn't collect a dime.

12.title: Joe Palooka
12.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby collects $5600 from a bet, but Ann's father isn't well and she's taking him on a cruise.

13.title: Joe Palooka
13.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby set out to buy a car.

14.title: Joe Palooka
14.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: A used car costs $800.

15.title: Joe Palooka
15.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby set out toward Sacramento, then Yosemite, Reno, Santa Fe and Albuquerque.

16.title: Joe Palooka
16.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby stops to eat after they've just eaten, because the girl behind the counter is attractive.

17.title: Joe Palooka
17.author: by Ham FIsher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby drive through the Mariposa Grove, and almost collide with a redwood tree.

18.title: Joe Palooka
18.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby discusses the scenery in Reno, which to him means girls.

19.title: Joe Palooka
19.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby's at the roulette wheel, but Joe won't gamble.

20.title: Joe Palooka
20.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby loses at gambling.

21.title: Joe Palooka
21.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby bumps into a Miss Adelle Durfee, who recognizes Joe's name.

22.title: Joe Palooka
22.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby sends Joe to bed and plans an evening with Dell Durfee.

23.title: Joe Palooka
23.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby volunteers to drive Miss Durfee home to the Lazy Q Ranch.

24.title: Joe Palooka
24.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Adelle Durfee gets home and tells her friend Cuddles Hanigin that she's struck oil.

25.title: Joe Palooka
25.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby gets home after sunrise, wakes Joe and tells him about Adelle.

26.title: Joe Palooka
26.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby's heading out to the dude ranch to pick up Adelle, without having had any sleep.

27.title: Joe Palooka
27.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Adelle introduces Knobby to Cuddles Hanigin, and she pours on the flattery.

28.title: Joe Palooka
28.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby and Adelle plan a double date with Joe and Cuddles.

29.title: Joe Palooka
29.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe objects to the date, but Knobby convinces him to think of it as chaperoning and not as cheating on Ann.

30.title: Joe Palooka
30.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe suggests dinner and a movie, but Knobby wants to go dancing.

31.title: Joe Palooka
31.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe is not much of a dancer, and won't drink or smoke.

32.title: Joe Palooka
32.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe finds out that Knobby isn't planning to leave Reno for weeks.

33.title: Joe Palooka
33.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: The two couples hit six joints.

34.title: Joe Palooka
34.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: After dropping the women off, Joe falls asleep. Cuddles and Adelle discuss their respective roles as chaperone and sweet shy girl.

35.title: Joe Palooka
35.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby buy new clothes.

36.title: Joe Palooka
36.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby ride out to meet Cuddles and Adelle.

37.title: Joe Palooka
37.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe didn't know they were meeting the girls.

38.title: Joe Palooka
38.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: A cowboy named Larry comes by and wants to join their picnic, and Knobby takes exception.

39.title: Joe Palooka
39.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Larry leaves when he catches sight of Joe, and Knobby seems to imagine that it was his own behavior that chased him away.

40.title: Joe Palooka
40.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby and Dell engage in some sweet talk.

41.title: Joe Palooka
41.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Dell finds out that Knobby's broke, and her word balloons grow icicles.

42.title: Joe Palooka
42.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Dell's angry because she's found out Knobby is broke.

43.title: Joe Palooka
43.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby wonders why Dell's suddenly unfriendly, and Joe suggests that she misunderstood something Knobby didn't say.

44.title: Joe Palooka
44.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Cuddles explains to Dell that she may have been too hasty, that Knobby may be back in the millions in six months.

45.title: Joe Palooka
45.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby are ready to leave, when Knobby hears that Dell wants to talk to him.

46.title: Joe Palooka
46.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Dell tells Knobby she loves him.

47.title: Joe Palooka
47.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby goes to a jewelry store and buys a ring on credit for $5000.

48.title: Joe Palooka
48.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe admires the diamond ring (biggest he ever saw), then asks Knobby for a few dollars of their money.

49.title: Joe Palooka
49.author: by Ham Fisher.
49.series: Oct. 24, 1939) "The Time, the Place, the Girl"
notes: Summary: Rowing on Lake Tahoe, Knobby brings out the ring for Dell.

50.title: Joe Palooka
50.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Dell complains that the diamond in the ring is too small, and Knobby tells her to just take it in and get one she likes.

51.title: Joe Palooka
51.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Adelle says they should get married in February, and plans to help manage Joe.

52.title: Joe Palooka
52.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby explains the financial arrangement between him and Joe.

53.title: Joe Palooka
53.author: by Ham Fisher.
53.series: Oct. 28, 1939) "A Bit on the Small Side"
notes: Summary: Cuddles is happy about the engagement ring, but she thinks the diamond's a little small.

54.title: Joe Palooka
54.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: The ring Dell has chosen costs $10,000, and Knobby says it's okay.

55.title: Joe Palooka
55.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Dell suddenly decides she doesn't want to wait to get married.

56.title: Joe Palooka
56.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Dell's picking up a fancy wardrobe, and charging it to Knobby.

57.title: Joe Palooka
57.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby's nervous about getting married.

58.title: Joe Palooka
58.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe drops in on an old friend, Willie Rush, who hears Knobby's been going around with Dell Durfee.

59.title: Joe Palooka
59.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Willie Rush tells Joe that Dell Durfee's had six divorces, and she's only in it for the money. Joe gets upset.

60.title: Joe Palooka
60.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Willie's only trying to help by telling the truth about Dell.

61.title: Joe Palooka
61.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby finds out that Dell's been charging her trousseau to his account.

62.title: Joe Palooka
62.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby finds out that Dell has charged two fur coats, ten gowns, etc., to his account.

63.title: Joe Palooka
63.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: A black maid shows a Mr. Lefcourt in to see Adelle Durfee, and she's not happy to see him.

64.title: Joe Palooka
64.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby is told that Dell is out, so he decides to wait.

65.title: Joe Palooka
65.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby hears Dell talk about her plans to use him to get clothes, jewels and cars.

66.title: Joe Palooka
66.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby takes off, and Dell realizes he's overheard, but she says he'll marry her or she'll sue for breach of promise.

67.title: Joe Palooka
67.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby runs to the hotel and tells Joe to get ready, they're leaving immediately.

68.title: Joe Palooka
68.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Before they can leave the hotel, the jewelry store calls about the ring.

69.title: Joe Palooka
69.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby make it to the city limits without being caught by creditors.

70.title: Joe Palooka
70.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby finds out that Joe knows Dell's been divorced six times.

71.title: Joe Palooka
71.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby make it over the state line to Utah.

72.title: Joe Palooka
72.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby stay in a tourist camp.

73.title: Joe Palooka
73.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: A telegram invites them to Boys Town, so it's off to Omaha, which Joe thinks is somewhere in Michigan.

74.title: Joe Palooka
74.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby thinks the Great Salt Lake is a mirage, and jumps in.

75.title: Joe Palooka
75.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby pick up a boy, who asks for water.

76.title: Joe Palooka
76.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: The hitchhiker's father left him with his grandmother, the grandmother died and he has nowhere to go.

77.title: Joe Palooka
77.author: by Ham Fisher.
77.series: Nov. 25, 1939) "I Wonder if Father Flanagan'll Take Him In?"*
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby wonder what to do with their hitchhiker.

78.title: Joe Palooka
78.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Eddie Burdin (the hitchhiker) sleeps on the couch and takes a bath, and enjoys the experiences.

79.title: Joe Palooka
79.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby decide not to buy Eddie new clothes, so he'll look poor and get accepted into Boys Town.

80.title: Joe Palooka
80.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe, Knobby and Eddie arrive at Boys Town, where Father Flanagan is waiting.

81.title: Joe Palooka
81.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: The boys all turn out to welcome Knobby, Joe and Eddie, and Father Flanagan shakes hands with Joe.

82.title: Joe Palooka
82.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Father Flanagan accepts Eddie into Boys Town.

83.title: Joe Palooka
83.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Father Flanagan explains the non-sectarian nature of Boys Town.

84.title: Joe Palooka
84.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe referees a boxing match at Boys Town, and the boxers start before the bell rings.

85.title: Joe Palooka
85.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: The Boys Town boxers start before the bell rings, and refuse to stop when the next one rings.

86.title: Joe Palooka
86.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe shows the boys at Boys Town a little boxing with a friend from Omaha, Jerry Shafer.

87.title: Joe Palooka
87.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby get ready to leave Father Flanagan and Eddie.

88.title: Joe Palooka
88.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby leave Boys Town.

89.title: Joe Palooka
89.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby pick up a tough-looking hitchiker.

90.title: Joe Palooka
90.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby and Joe stake their hitchhiker to a bed and a meal, and he orders more than they do.

91.title: Joe Palooka
91.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe's changing a tire, and the hitchhiker doesn't offer to help.

92.title: Joe Palooka
92.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby turn in, but their hitchhiker is up sneaking around.

93.title: Joe Palooka
93.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: The hitchhiker sneaks into the cabin where Joe and Knobby are sleeping, and back out again.

94.title: Joe Palooka
94.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: At breakfast, the hitchhiker seems to be missing.

95.title: Joe Palooka
95.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby goes to pay for breakfast, and his wallet is missing.

96.title: Joe Palooka
96.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Not only are the hitchhiker and the wallet gone, but so's the car.

97.title: Joe Palooka
97.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe has enough to pay the bill, but they can't call the sheriff because there's no phone.

98.title: Joe Palooka
98.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Another camper offers Joe and Knobby a ride.

99.title: Joe Palooka
99.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: The car is crowded, and they're heading back toward Omaha, but Joe and Knobby are grateful.

100.title: Joe Palooka
100.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby are dropped off in Ashton near the police station.

101.title: Joe Palooka
101.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby makes a collect call from Ashton through South Bend.

102.title: Joe Palooka
102.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: The story is on hold while Fisher wishes everyone Peace on Earth.

103.title: Joe Palooka
103.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby tries to reverse the charges to get help from New York.

104.title: Joe Palooka
104.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Knobby's telegrams asking for money get only one response, and that one asks to be repaid a $100 golf debt.

105.title: Joe Palooka
105.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby ask at the bank for a loan, and the loan officer calls the police.

106.title: Joe Palooka
106.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: The police think Joe and Knobby are pulling a confidence game.

107.title: Joe Palooka
107.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby are in jail, and Eephrum leaves for South Bend to look in the rogue's gallery for their photographs.

108.title: Joe Palooka
108.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: In jail without cigars for Knobby, the boys decide not to break the bars out of the window because they might get shot.

109.title: Joe Palooka
109.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Eephrum looks through the pictures in the South Bend police station, and admits he doesn't know what the real Joe Palooka and Knobby Walsh look like.

110.title: Joe Palooka
110.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: Marianne brings news of a wounded American, down behind the lines, and the doctor gets up to go with her.

111.title: Joe Palooka
111.author: Ham Fisher.
111.series: July 20, 1946) "Tell 'em about the Set-Up in Those Other Countries to Make Atom Bombs"*
notes: Summary: Mrs. Sampson was poisoned with a turkey full of strychnine, and one of the Nazis has confessed. Bimmellman had atomic secrets.

112.title: Joe Palooka
112.author: [No author]
112.series: July 25, 1946) "Them Beauty Contests is All Crooked"*
notes: Summary: Poil has decided to enter the "bathin' beauty contess at the Supoib Bath for Miss Atomic Blonde of 1946 at Coney Island."

113.title: Joe Palooka
113.author: Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: The winner of the contest (the only natural blonde) is revealed.

114.title: Joe Palooka
114.author: Ham Fisher.
114.series: Sept. 6, 1946) "I Don't Drink Major, but I'll be Glad to Talk"*
notes: A Major is waiting in the hotel lobby, and wants to talk to Joe.

115.title: Joe Palooka
115.author: Ham Fisher.
115.series: Sept. 7, 1946) "I Only Hope You Can Find Someone Like Her, I Mean Almost"*
notes: Summary: The Major talks about how wonderful Ann Howe is, and how Joe had better give her the "finest life any girl ever had," and Joe promises.

116.title: Joe Palooka
116.author: Ham Fisher.
116.series: Sept. 14, 1946) "Hey, Joe, Got a Letter Fer Ya"*
notes: Summary: The mailman hands Joe a letter.

117.title: Joe Palooka
117.author: Ham Fisher.
117.series: Sept. 16, 1946) "Ann's Coming Home, She's Out of the Service, She's Coming Home"*
notes: Summary: Joe's letter has exciting news.

118.title: Joe Palooka
118.author: by Ham Fisher.
118.series: Jan. 20, 1956) "Remember, Knobby and I Lost all our Savings"*
notes: Summary: Joe and Knobby are saying goodbye to Joanie, and a worried Ann.

119.title: Joe Palooka
119.author: Ham Fisher, M
119.series: July 17, 1958) "Be Smart. Give Up This Place Now"*
notes: Summary: Joe is warned away from his new summer home in Newton; Knobby and the fellas are heading upstate to give Joe a birthday party.

120.title: Joe Palooka
120.author: by Ham Fisher
120.appears_in: reproduced on p. 100-101 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Humphrey Pennyworth hits a bucket of balls, all at once.

121.author: Jeff Rovin

156.heading: Joe Palooka--Miscellanea.
156.title: "Joe Palooka and Me"
156.author: by Ham Fisher
notes: Fisher describes his career in words, and in an autobiographical 5-tier color strip.
Also on p. 10 of this issue is a photograph of Fisher dedicating a statue of Joe Palooka in Bedford, Indiana.

157.heading: Joe Palooka--Miscellanea.
157.title: "Joe Palooka and the Most Famous Food Fight of the Funnies"
157.author: R
157.appears_in: C. Harvey. p. 101-110 in The Comics Journal, no. 168 (May 1994)
notes: (Reruns & Revivals)
On Ham Fisher and Joe Palooka, and Al Capp and Li'l Abner.

158.heading: Joe Palooka--Miscellanea.
158.title: "Joe Palooka Comic Strip Ends" p. 26 in The Comics Journal, no. 95
158.author: [No author]
notes: Data from Pete Coogan.

159.heading: Joe Palooka--Miscellanea.
159.title: "Morris Weiss, Mickey Finn, and the Palooka"
159.author: by R
159.appears_in: C. Harvey. p. 74-83 in Cartoonist Profiles, no. 107 (Sept. 1995).
notes: Article on Weiss, with illustrations by Weiss, Ham Fisher, Ken Maynard, and James Montgomery Flagg, and photographs of Weiss and Lank Leonard.
Four pages of Mickey Finn dailies reprinted.

160.heading: Joe Palooka--Parodies, Imitations, Etc.
160.title: "Joe Palooka" p. 78-79 in Sex in Comics, v. 1
160.author: by D

164.title: "Joe Palooka in The Loosing Fight" p. 123-124 in Sex in Comics, v. 1
164.author: by D
164.appears_in: H. Gilmore (San Diego, Calif. : Greenleaf Classics, 1971)

165.title: "Stop N. Takit Present Joe Palooka with Knobby" p. 36-37 in Sex in Comics, v. 1
165.author: by D
165.appears_in: H. Gilmore (San Diego, Calif. : Greenleaf Classics, 1971)

166.heading: Joe Palooka--Parodies, Imitations, Etc.
166.title: "Whotta Kavity Presents Joe Palooka" p. 70-71 in Sex in Comics, v. 2
166.author: by D
166.appears_in: H. Gilmore (San Diego, Calif. : Greenleaf Classics, 1971)

167.heading: Joe Palooka--Parodies, Imitations, Etc.
167.title: "Whotta Kavity Presents Joe Palooka" p. 40 in Tijuana Bibles, Art and Wit in America's Forbidden Funnies, 1930s-1950s
167.author: Bob Adelman (New York : Simon & Schuster, 1997).
notes: A Tijuana bible reprint.

168.heading: "Joe Palooka and Me" / by Ham Fisher. p. 28 in Colliers, v.
168.title: 122, no. 16
168.author: [No author]
notes: Fisher describes his career in words, and in an autobiographical 5-tier color strip.
Also on p. 10 of this issue is a photograph of Fisher dedicating a statue of Joe Palooka in Bedford, Indiana.
